When I woke I found myself in a dark room with light streaming in through holes in the walls. My stuff was just to the side of my bed and I was wearing new cloths that itched and had a special hole for my tail. Out side I could here voices calling and people bustling about and
I could smell chimaeras like myself and strange dents I did not know. Blushing I smelled the sent of heat and realized that I needed to be careful around guys especially the chimaeras because they could smell me.
But what to do next? go outside? Wait here?
1442.title: Chimaera

choices: The journey (this is all you guys I don't do this sorta thing)
14421.content:
Suddenly while I was lost in thought I heard someone trying to be sneaky shuffling about outside my door. The door knob rattled and I grabbed my dagger which I had found on my nightstand. Then the door opened and a figure slipped in closing the door behind them. Stealthily I crept up to the figure who I could easily make out to be a male human about my age with a rapidly beating heart and fear evident on his face. Gabbing him by the mouth and placing the dagger infront of him so he could see it I waited for him to calm down before I sat him on the bed and removed my hand. Then came the questions "where am I" I asked. The boy told me everything, I was In camp phytus the boys camp north of camp valese and he was hiding from some guys who wanted him to pay up on a dare.
Thinking for a second about my situation and how I was beggining my heat and in a boys camp full of chimaeras I came up with a plan I told the boy I would give him he money for his bet if he took me to camp valese.
He agreed
14421.title: Stay here see what happens

14422.content:
Quietly i walked over to one of the larger holes in the wall and peered through. Another eye looked back. Stumbling backward in surprise and shock i tripped over a lump in the carpet sending myself flying into the wall behind me. As i sat on the floor rubbing the back of my head the door flew open and a smiling dark haired very tan girl barged in with a duffle bag around one arm. "Hi my names Tara" said the girl throwing her duffle on the other bed in the room. Walking over to me she grabbed my hand and pulled me up to my feet. "I know your wondering where you are, I was too at first" walking over to the door she continued "come on the boys are almost here and mrs Noriega wants to see you before they arrive." I had so many questions but I bit my tongue and followed her out the door.
Out side I found that what I had awoken in was one of hundreds maybe thousands of similar huts. At the bottom of a great crescent shaped fortress. There was no other word for it where the mountains ended a wall made out of an unknown material began, reaching over three stories high with watch towers and battlements. The higher up the bowl shaped crescent one traveled the more unique and sturdy the houses became changing from extravagant wooden houses to brick to stone with engravings and overlays of precious stones and metals. At the top was a castle like building with ramparts towers walls and statutes. We seemed to be heading towards the castle like building. As we headed upwards the roads became more like stairs and I began to see over the horizon a large mass of ... something... I had never seen so many bodies but what they were I could only guess at.
The people we passed by were a wide array of ethnicities and religions. And sprinkled in among them were chimaeras of species I never knew existed. Bird chimaeras some with wings for arms but flexible and able to hold turn and write with objects. Bird chimaeras with wings out their backs. Reptilian and chimaeras of exotic mammals. All of them I knew could smell my heat beginning as they turned their heads and winked.
Soon we reached the top of the climb and I was surprised to find little kids at such an adult looking place. Around the level section of the castle was gorgeous gardens and beautiful murals some being added to while we passed. What could this place possible be? Lost in thought i did not realise we were at our destination until I walked straight into Tara.

"Here is where everything in this camp is decided. here is a true wonder of the world. " before opening the doors to a magnificent sight. The room was covered in maps, maps of cities towns forests underground tunnels, the floor was even a giant mosaic map. Turning round and round staring with wonder at every map strewn about the place I saw far point up. That's when I realised we were at the base of a tower in the castle and that as far as the eye could see the tower was covered in books and maps and papers. Instead of solid floor people climbed about on steel chains connected to the walls around and a single pillar in the center of he room also covered in books.
Suddenly one of the figures that was navigating the chains began jumping from section to section, flipping and spinning, twisting and turning till she landed behind me barely stirring the dust at her feet. The woman was about six feet tall with light brown hair blue eyes and lightly tanned skin. From a quick glance she looked like any thirty year old women, but her skin rippled with hidden strength I could only guess at. And her eyes though bright with inner fire seemed to hide something ... Dark.
"Well Mia I see you have made it here unharmed," the woman said looking me over mentally ticking off points of interest with her eyes," hope those traps weren't to frightful, we have to have some deterrent for those who would want to expose this place."
Getting over my awe and slight fear I finally spoke up and asked "what is this place?" Gesturing at the view of the fortress below I continued "it's like nothing I have ever seen before. There are people of many races and chimaera species but all of them are girls, and this place is like a fortress!" The woman just looked amused at my childish demeanor.
"This place is camp Valese. Sanctuary, summer camp, and a town of sorts. To make a long story short this place was founded hundreds of years ago by Native American tribes as a place for outcasts and outsiders to go and stay. In later years when explorers from France England and eventually Spain found it they decided to keep it a secret and only spoke about it around those who knew the signs and code of the village. When wars began they were allowed refuge in the crescent walls and took shelter from the fighting. As a thanks the settlers and explorers who stayed built the foundation for that wall over there." Here the woman paused and pointed out at the wall that finished the near natural circle. "It became tradition for people who were with no place to go to take shelter here and to in payment share their knowledge with the others. Then over time the place split into two groups as times changed and a summer camp was established here. The other group the men and boys who wanted to live separately from the girls left to the north finding another valley to settle in. But the families stayed here due to the traveling conditions. Eventually things settled to as they are today. We work as two groups working together to help those in need and teach those who wished to learn. In these four towers are one of the largest collections of learning in the world. Most Scientists and explorers from round the world were at one time or another par of this society. We protect our secret with many traps and puzzles that only those with true determination are willing to pass. You can leave and enter whenever you want during the summer but unless you are a sworn member of the group or in dire need of sanctuary one cannot enter during the rest of the year after your 18th birth day. The boys you saw coming here are here for the annual events so please do not big them too much. Also no leaving the camp to where the boys are camped outside after dark. Turning back to face me her friendly expression turned sour, "please do not enter the caves or tunnels around this mountain. There are dangers in them not even our best spelunkers could ever pass. And do not tell anyone our secret. We have our ways to find out and punish those who tell." Suddenly her face went happy again "Now that that's over I shall have Tara here show you around, Tara has been coming here since she was eleven and can tell you everything that is going on in the camp to the nearest minute."
Just as quickly as she came the woman began an arduous climb back up the chains to a section of books and began reading. Grabbing my arm Tara began pulling me away saying "she is pretty nice once you get to know her."

As we walked down from the mountain Tara asked me what I wanted to do first.
